meanings.definition: A consistently unlucky or unfortunate person.
meanings.sent1: Poor Jerry always seems to be the schlimazel in our group, always losing his keys or tripping over things.
meanings.sent2: The schlimazel in the story could never catch a break, no matter how hard he tried.
meanings.sent3: The schlimazel at the party accidentally spilled punch on themselves, adding to their streak of bad luck.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a schlimazel with a dark cloud following her wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The schlimazel's life was like a never-ending series of unfortunate events.

meanings.definition: To have a string of bad luck or misfortune.
meanings.sent1: I hope I don't schlimazel my way through the upcoming exam like I did last time.
meanings.sent2: After losing his job, he felt like he was schlimazeling through life with no end in sight.
meanings.sent3: She seemed to schlimazel her way into one mishap after another during the camping trip.
meanings.sent4: The team's performance seemed to schlimazel as they faced one setback after another.
meanings.sent5: The car's engine continued to schlimazel, causing delays on the road trip.

meanings.definition: Someone who is prone to experiencing bad luck.
meanings.sent1: As the designated schlimazel of the group, he was always the one to drop the ball.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a schlimazel magnet, attracting bad luck wherever she went.
meanings.sent3: The poor schlimazel managed to trip over their own feet even on a clear path.
meanings.sent4: He was the schlimazel of the office, always getting the faulty printer.
meanings.sent5: The schlimazel's presence seemed to bring a wave of misfortune to those around them.
